intro: Hieraciodes bithynica, commonly known as the Bithynian Hieracium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
